info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 5:09AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A narrow line of downpours with gusty winds will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, Berkshire, eastern Schenectady, Columbia, Rensselaer, Ulster, Dutchess, Albany, Greene, southeastern Saratoga, southern Washington, southern Windham and southern Bennington Counties through 615 AM EST... At 508 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking downpours with gusty winds along a line extending from 8 miles west of Hoosick Falls to near Napanoch. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Pittsfield, Bennington, Clifton Park, Poughkeepsie, Rotterdam, Kingston, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Beacon, North Adams, Brattleboro, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Scotia, Great Barrington and New Paltz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 near exit 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 7, and between exits 8A and 11. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
